author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued an executive order to ban the sale of THC products to minors, while directing state agencies to create a comprehensive regulatory framework for the products.
title: Abbott moves to ban THC sales to minors in Texas

author: Julia Mueller
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom on Wednesday condemned the shooting of Charlie Kirk, the co-founder of conservative Turning Point USA, as "reprehensible" and "vile." “The attack on Charlie Kirk is disgusting, vile, and reprehensible. In the United States of America, we must reject political violence in EVERY form,” Newsom wrote on X.  Newsom notably welcomed Kirk...
title: Newsom condemns 'reprehensible' Charlie Kirk shooting

author: Tobias Burns
description: Republicans’ One Big Beautiful Bill Act will shrink the size of the U.S. population by hundreds of thousands of people, mostly due to new laws supporting Trump’s immigration crackdown. The Congressional Budget Office (CBO) found Wednesday that by 2035, there will be 320,000 fewer people in the U.S. subject to Social Security and 280,000 fewer...
title: Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’ to shrink U.S. population: CBO

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump called for prayers for conservative activist Charlie Kirk after the co-founder of Turning Point USA appeared to be struck by a gunshot on Wednesday while appearing at an event at Utah Valley University. “We must all pray for Charlie Kirk, who has been shot. A great guy from top to bottom. GOD BLESS...
title: Trump urges prayers for Charlie Kirk

author: Max Rego
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) pushed for sanctions on Russia in the wake of its drones violating Polish airspace on Wednesday.  Graham's urgings come after President Trump said, “What’s with Russia violating Poland’s airspace with drones? Here we go!” on Truth Social Wednesday.  “Mr. President, Congress is with you,” Graham said on X, with a screenshot of President Trump’s...
title: Graham pushes Trump on Russia sanctions after 'Here we go!' post

author: Sharon Udasin
description: The federal government will now allow its firefighters to mask up — upending a decades-long policy that had left them exposed to toxic flurries of illness-inducing wildfire smoke. The U.S. Forest Service this week issued new guidance for wildland firefighters regarding the voluntary use of N95 respirators via the National Interagency Fire Center’s health program, as first...
title: Federal wildland firefighters can now mask up, in long-standing policy reversal

author: Tara Suter
description: The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) issued a preliminary report Wednesday detailing its probe of a Delta Air Lines flight that experienced "severe" turbulence in late July, sending more than a dozen people to the hospital. The safety board said Delta Flight 56, en route from Salt Lake City to Amsterdam, encountered the significant turbulence...
title: NTSB details turbulence that struck Delta jet in July

author: Ella Lee
description: The man accused of slinging a sandwich at a federal officer in Washington, D.C., which turned him into a symbol of opposition to President Trump’s crackdown on local crime, has pleaded not guilty to misdemeanor assault.  Sean Charles Dunn, 37, entered the plea in federal court Wednesday afternoon.   He stood before U.S. District Judge...
title: DC 'sandwich guy' pleads not guilty to misdemeanor assault, trial set for November

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: A divided federal appeals court panel reinstated the director of the U.S. Copyright Office Wednesday, as she fights President Trump’s attempt to fire her.  Shira Perlmutter lost in a lower court but is appealing to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit.  Wednesday’s 2-1 decision rules Perlmutter’s firing was likely unlawful and blocks...
title: Appeals court blocks Trump from firing Copyright Office director

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Three former high-ranking FBI agents are suing Director Kash Patel in a suit seeking reinstatements to their posts, saying they were fired as part of a retribution campaign directed by highest levels of the Trump administration. Brian Driscoll, who served as acting director before Patel was confirmed, rebuffed early requests to turn over a list of all...
title: Fired FBI officials sue Kash Patel, alleging 'campaign of retribution'

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Poland invoked Article 4 of the North Atlantic Treaty after Russian drones illegally entered Polish airspace, prompting NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte to denounce Russia's "reckless" and "dangerous" behavior and call for increased defense spending.
title: NATO's Article 4 invoked over Russian drones in Poland: What to know

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) issued a safety alert on Tuesday warning of the risk of uncontrollable fires associated with lithium batteries. Spare lithium batteries are generally prohibited in checked luggage, but even in carry-on baggage, they can malfunction and pose a risk to passengers and crew members. Lithium batteries are also often found in...
title: FAA warns of fire risk from lithium batteries

author: Carole Plowfield, opinion contributor
description: The Senate needs to stop the procedural delays and give these nominees an up-or-down vote immediately.
title: Senate confirmation delays endanger national security

author: Julia Shapero
description: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has dethroned Tesla CEO Elon Musk as the world’s richest person.  Ellison’s net worth grew a massive $101 billion Wednesday morning to $393 billion, surpassing Musk’s $385 billion fortune, according to Bloomberg.   The surge in Ellison’s wealth comes after Oracle’s stock soared 40 percent Wednesday. The company reported earnings late...
title: Elon Musk dethroned as world's richest person

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The Senate Banking Committee voted along party lines Thursday to advance the nomination of President Trump's top White House economist to a stint on the Federal Reserve Board. Senators voted 13-11 to approve the nomination of Stephen Miran, chair of the White House Council of Economic Advisers (CEA), to a Fed board term set to...
title: Senate panel clears Trump's top economist for Fed board

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Two of the biggest teachers unions in the country are suing the Trump administration over its immigration crackdown, saying schools are suffering because of it.  The National Education Association (NEA) and the American Federation of Teachers joined a federal lawsuit Tuesday after the Trump administration took away the directive for immigration officials to stay away...
title: Teachers unions sue over Trump immigration crackdown

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A survivor of sex crimes performed by deceased financier Jeffrey Epstein on Tuesday said she’s “not sure” if the president understands what she’s trying to communicate to him. “He hears me, the president is hearing me," Haley Robson, an Epstein survivor, said of her request for the president’s condolences, during an appearance on CNN’s “Erin...
title: Epstein survivor 'not sure' Trump is 'comprehending what I am trying to communicate to him

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer (N.Y.) sent an explicit warning to Republican leaders Wednesday that the proposals they are considering to fund the government and avoid a shutdown on Oct. 1 do not have enough Democratic votes to pass the Senate. “What the Republicans have proposed is not good enough to meet the needs of...
title: Schumer warns GOP government funding proposals don’t have the votes to pass

author: Sen. Rick Scott (R-Fla.), opinion contributor
description: The U.S. and the Philippines share a strong alliance based on shared values and strategic interests, and by working together, the two nations can counter China's aggression in the Indo-Pacific region and ensure freedom of navigation in the South China Sea.
title: US-Philippine alliance is vital to Trump’s fight against Communist China

author: Tara Suter
description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore (D), who has been floated as a potential 2028 presidential contender, said on Tuesday he is "living the dream" as governor after announcing his reelection bid. “I'm excited about running for reelection. And, you know, I'm literally a person who was raised by an immigrant, single mom, who had handcuffs on...
title: Wes Moore on reelection bid: 'I am living the dream right now'

author: Cate Martel
description: It’s Wednesday. Who else was caught off guard by the dreary, misty rain this morning? Sorry to anyone who thought they were going to have a good hair day. In today's issue: 📘 NEWS THIS MORNING The world is on edge today: There has been a major escalation from Russia. Russian drones breached Poland’s airspace...
title: Poland airspace violation sparks NATO frenzy toward Russia

author: Emily Brooks
description: House Republicans took up a slate of bills on Wednesday aimed at overhauling Washington, D.C.’s criminal justice system and reduce the autonomy of the local government, coming as President Trump’s takeover of the local police department expires at the end of the day. The action amounts to Republicans’ way of carrying on Trump’s crusade against...
title: House GOP takes up slate of DC crime bills as Trump’s federal takeover ends

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: CBS News says it wants to get serious about bias. So, the network just created a new position: ombudsman. The job description sounds reasonable — someone who investigates complaints from viewers and evaluates whether coverage is fair. But here’s where it gets messy: they gave the job to Kenneth R. Weinstein.   Now, Weinstein isn’t just...
title: CBS appoints former Trump ambassador as bias watchdog — absurd

author: Nancy Jacobson and Holly Page, opinion contributors
description: The Democratic Party must be willing to confront and reject the socialist and antisemitic ideas of the Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) in order to win elections and serve the public interest.
title: Moderate Democrats must denounce socialism, not help rebrand it

author: Brooke Migdon
description: A federal judge on Tuesday stopped an attempt by the Trump administration to subpoena medical records and confidential information of transgender patients who received gender-affirming care at Boston Children’s Hospital, calling the Justice Department’s investigation of such care improper and “motivated only by bad faith.”  District Judge Myong J. Joun granted the hospital’s request to block...
title: Judge blocks DOJ subpoena in Boston gender-affirming care investigation

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Ted Budd (R-N.C.) voted Tuesday against a procedural motion to advance the nomination of Robert Law to serve as under secretary for strategy, policy and plans at the Department of Homeland Security. Budd's vote protested the slow federal reimbursement to North Carolina for funds spent to recover from Hurricane Helene. “This is not about...
title: Budd casts procedural vote against DHS nominee to protest slow Helene relief

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer (N.Y.) ambushed Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) and the rest of Senate Republican leadership Wednesday morning by filing an amendment to the National Defense Authorization Act to direct Attorney General Pam Bondi to make public all unclassified records, documents and communications related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Schumer...
title: Schumer ambushes Republicans with amendment to force vote on Epstein files

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Elon Musk said that he believes the federal government is irreparably broken after his brief stint leading the White House's Department of Government Efficiency, and that AI and robots are the only way to solve the national debt.
title: Musk on his Washington tenure: 'The government is basically unfixable'

author: Craig A. Deare, opinion contributor
description: After more than a decade of failed diplomatic efforts, it may be time to confront a difficult truth: Military action could be the only remaining tool to restore democracy and stability in Venezuela.
title: US military action in Venezuela may be best option

author: Emily Brooks
description: A committee meeting on bills to exert greater federal control over the District of Columbia's criminal justice system erupted Wednesday as Rep. Maxwell Frost (D-Fla.) and Rep. Clay Higgins (R-La.) got in a shouting match, with Frost calling Higgins a “lapdog” for President Trump. Frost had asked Higgins, the sponsor of a bill to allow...
title: Democrat Frost calls GOP’s Higgins ‘lapdog’ for Trump as DC crime bill meeting erupts

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Let me be abundantly clear: The person who deserves blame is the perpetrator, and anyone who participated in a system that wrongfully allowed a violent, criminal, schizophrenic man to be out on the streets.
title: Iryna Zarutska murder video draws outrage — don’t blame the bystanders

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: The U.S. death rate has dropped to prepandemic levels as COVID-19 fell out of the top 10 leading causes of death, according to research published Wednesday. The death rate fell by 3.8 percent in 2024, with the overall rate declining from 750.5 per 100,000 people in 2023 to 722 per 100,000 last year, the Centers...
title: COVID-19 no longer a top 10 cause of death: CDC

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said Wednesday that there’s “no evidence” the Russian drone incursion into Polish airspace was an accident. Overnight, Polish armed forces warned that the country's airspace was “repeatedly violated” by drone-like objects as Russia was carrying out massive strikes on Ukrainian territory. "As I just said in the German parliament, there...
title: 'No evidence whatsoever' that Russian drone incursion in Poland was accident: German defense chief

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump offered his first reaction Wednesday to Russian drones violating Poland’s airspace in a brazen move by President Vladimir Putin that stands to escalate the war with Ukraine and tensions with Europe. “What’s with Russia violating Poland’s airspace with drones? Here we go!” Trump wrote on Truth Social in a brief post. A White...
title: Trump on Russian drones in Poland airspace: ‘Here we go!’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Israel targeted Houthi leaders in a Wednesday strike on rebels’ government offices in Sanaa, the capital of Yemen. “The strikes were conducted in response to repeated attacks by the Iranian-backed Houthis, including launching UAVs and surface-to-surface missiles toward Israeli territory,” the Israel Defense Forces wrote in a statement on X, noting additional attacks on the...
title: Israel targets Houthi rebels in Yemen capital

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy on Wednesday said the federal government is launching an investigation into the Charlotte transit system’s security protocols after the death of a Ukrainian woman made national headlines. The Department of Transportation said in a statement that the Federal Transit Administration (FTA) has requested information on the Charlotte Area Transit System’s (CATS) "actions...
title: Duffy investigating Charlotte transit system security after Ukrainian woman's death

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump’s approval rating on the economy fell to 36 percent, even as his overall approval ticked up two points to 42 percent, according to the latest Reuters/Ipsos survey. The five-day poll, which concluded Tuesday, shows Trump’s approval on the economy slipped one point from 37 percent last month and two points from late July....
title: Trump approval on economy slips to 36 percent: Survey

author: Brad Bannon, opinion contributor
description: The Trump economy is struggling, with few jobs created in August and prices increasing, while the president's promise to reduce prices has not been fulfilled, making inflation a key issue for Democrats to focus on in the upcoming midterm elections.
title: Jobs are down, prices are up and Trump is in trouble

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Qatar has accused Israel of violating international law with its airstrikes targeting Hamas leaders in a residential area of Doha, while Israel claims it attempted to minimize civilian harm and is justified in its actions against Hamas for initiating the October 7th massacre.
title: Qatar: Israeli strike constitutes 'flagrant violation of international laws'

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The family of Iryna Zarutska, the Ukrainian woman killed last month on the light rail in Charlotte, N.C., is now pressing the city's leaders for public safety reform following her violent death. “This could have been anyone riding the light rail that night,” the family told NewsNation, The Hill’s sister network, in a statement. “We...
title: Iryna Zarutska's family calls for public safety reform after Ukrainian woman's death in Charlotte

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick indicated the Trump administration is looking to take a cut of the revenue generated by university patents developed through federally funded research. Lutnick in an interview with Axios published Wednesday discussed taking a portion of revenue from the patents, arguing it is unfair for the government to give universities the money...
title: Trump administration wants cut of universities' patent revenue: Lutnick

author: Gerard Scimeca, opinion contributor
description: His ongoing association and financial ties to predatory big-box law firms create a headache of conflicts that mix with MAGA like sugar in a gas tank.
title: RFK Jr’s HHS undermines conservative principles

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Trump administration on Wednesday proposed to revoke a Biden-era rule that sought to conserve more public lands as opposed to opening them up to mining, drilling or grazing. Land owned by the federal government may be leased to private entities, including companies, for uses including energy and minerals. The 2024 rule in question would have similarly...
title: Trump proposes to revoke Biden-era rule that aimed to conserve more public lands

author: Tara Suter
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk on Wednesday said his country is the closest to open conflict since World War II, according to multiple reports, likely referring to Russian drones that breached Poland’s airspace overnight. “I want to emphasize very strongly that there is no reason to claim we’re on the brink of war, but there...
title: Poland closest to open conflict since WWII, prime minister says

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries will speak with reporters Wednesday morning, with the shutdown deadline just over two weeks away. Jeffries and other Democratic leaders on Capitol Hill are looking to avoid a lapse in funding. The leaders have said privately that they will not draw a red line against President Trump's "pocket rescissions," instead...
title: Watch live: Jeffries gives remarks with shutdown deadline, immigration top of mind

author: Brett Samuels
description: Former Vice President Kamala Harris accused staffers of former President Biden of "adding fuel" to negative stories about her during their time in office in an excerpt published Wednesday from her forthcoming memoir. Harris wrote in the excerpt, published in The Atlantic, about how Biden's inner circle "seemed fine with it" when stories she viewed...
title: Harris: Biden staff 'was adding fuel to negative narratives that sprang up around me'

author: The Hill Staff
description: The House Education and Workforce Committee is holding a hearing Wednesday looking into the spread of antisemitism at K-12 schools. Last year, leaders of three large public school systems strongly denied allegations that antisemitism is running rampant in their schools. The House probe was sparked by the rise of pro-Palestinian protests at universities across the...
title: Watch live: House Education Committee convenes hearing on antisemitism in K-12 schools

author: Max Burns, opinion contributor
description: If Democrats want to build a media empire to rival MAGA’s digital dominance, they need to stop funding projects that only serve the interests of their creators
title: Democratic influencers just can’t figure out how to talk to voters

author: The Hill Staff
description: The Senate Commerce, Science and Transportation Committee on Wednesday morning is set to dive into President Trump's artificial intelligence (AI) strategy. Since returning to office in January, the president has signed several executive orders to bolster the technology, from an order that fast-tracks permits for more data centers to promoting the export of American-made tech...
title: Watch live: Senate panel looks at White House AI strategy

author: Julia Manchester
description: Former Brevard County School Board member Jennifer Jenkins (D) launched her campaign for Senate in Florida on Wednesday, challenging incumbent Sen. Ashley Moody (R-Fla.) in the red state.  Jenkins made headlines in 2020 when she ousted conservative school board member Tina Descovich, an ally of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) who went on to co-found...
title: Ex-Florida school board member launches Democratic challenge against Sen. Moody

author: Zach Kaplan
description: For some, exposure to a Burkholderia cepacia bacterium could "result in serious and life-threatening infections," the company said in a release.
title: Dozens of skin, hair products recalled over potentially 'life-threatening' bacteria

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: Iconic horror author Stephen King shared his top 10 movies of all time Monday, with some notable absences that didn't go unnoticed.
title: Stephen King lists his 10 favorite movies of all time

author: James Densley, David Pyrooz and Jillian Peterson, opinion contributors
description: Complex violence rarely has a single cause; Americans seem to sense that when they’re given space to think beyond talking points.
title: Americans agree more on mass shootings than politics makes it seem

description: At the start of President Trump’s first administration, Skye Perryman joined a small legal organization, without even a website, bent on holding power to account.  Now, she runs the group — Democracy Forward — which is 53 lawyers strong and among the most formidable legal foes to Trump’s second term agenda.   Since Trump returned to...
title: Legal group Democracy Forward battles Trump's agenda

author: Ella Lee
description: President Trump’s most significant economic initiative is now in the hands of the Supreme Court.  The justices announced Tuesday they will fast track whether Trump can use emergency powers to justify his sweeping tariffs worldwide, expediting oral arguments to the first week of November.   The stakes are tremendous.   A loss at the high...
title: Supreme Court seeks to avoid being cornered on Trump tariffs

author: Tara Suter
description: Former Vice President Harris suggests in her upcoming book that former President Biden’s decision to run for reelection last year amounted to “recklessness." “And of all the people in the White House, I was in the worst position to make the case that he should drop out,” Harris said in an excerpt for "107 Days,"...
title: Kamala Harris calls Biden’s decision to run 'recklessness'

author: Preston Brashers, opinion contributor
description: President Trump’s "big, beautiful bill" terminated electric vehicle tax credits and began phasing out subsidies for new wind and solar projects. These were important steps in ending what Trump calls the “Green New Scam” and undoing a huge piece of former President Joe Biden’s signature legislation, the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act. But the One Big...
title: Make green energy companies pay their fair share

description: Morning Report is The Hill's a.m. newsletter. Subscribe here. In today's issue: ▪ Supreme Court fast-tracks tariffs case ▪ Poland says Russian drones entered airspace ▪ White House runs defense on Epstein ▪ New York City’s Mamdani surges President Trump’s economic sway over tariffs, interest rates and job creation will be tested before the year ends. Conditions...

description: The Polish Armed Forces said its airspace was “repeatedly violated’ by drone-like objects during a Russian attack on Ukraine, adding that a military operation was underway to neutralize the objects. “Attention, during today's attack by the Russian Federation carrying out strikes on targets located in the territory of Ukraine, our airspace was repeatedly violated by...
title: Poland says its airspace was ‘repeatedly violated’ during Russian strikes on Ukraine

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump said the United States and India will continue negotiating the terms of their trade agreement, less than two weeks after the U.S. president slapped a new round of tariffs on India for purchasing Russian oil. In a post on Truth Social on Tuesday, Trump called Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi his “very good...
title: Trump says US, India continuing to negotiate trade deal

author: Julia Manchester
description: Democrats scored a win in the race to replace the late Rep. Gerry Connolly (D-Va.) in Virginia’s 11th Congressional District, narrowing the Republican majority in the House of Representatives.  Fairfax County Supervisor James Walkinshaw (D) handily defeated Republican Stewart Whitson, a former FBI agent, in the heavily Democratic-leaning district on Tuesday. The race offered some...
title: Key takeaways from Virginia special election, Boston mayor's race

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman al-Thani vowed on Tuesday to retaliate against Israel for its strike against Hamas’s political leadership based in Doha. “The State of Qatar is committed to act in a decisive way with anything that would target its territories and will reserve the right to retaliate and will take all...
title: Qatar calls for retaliation against Israel for strike in Doha

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: {beacon} Welcome to The Hill's Defense & NatSec newsletter {beacon} Defense &National Security Defense &National Security   The Big Story  Israel attacks Hamas leadership in Qatar - what to know Israel escalated its war against Hamas on Tuesday, launching an assassination strike against Hamas’s political leadership in Qatar, quickly drawing condemnation across the region.  ©...
title: Israel attacks Hamas leadership in Qatar - what to know

author: Jared Gans
description: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu (D) and Josh Kraft, the son of New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, advanced in the primary to the general election in the city’s mayoral race, Decision Desk HQ projects.  The race call formally sets up the head-to-head battle between Wu, Boston’s first female mayor and first Asian American mayor, who...
title: Wu, Kraft advance in Boston mayor's race

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump ventured just outside the White House's grounds on Tuesday to dine in downtown Washington, D.C., to highlight the federal crime crackdown nearly a month after his decision to send National Guard troops to the nation's capital. The president went to Joe’s Stone Crab, which is a couple blocks away from the White House,...
title: Trump dines in downtown DC to highlight city's safety after takeover
